marklogic.body: And when that phrase was used during the founding of the league of nations in 1920? Or how about when it was used at the end of WWII, after the victory over the axis powers in WWII, which was credited in news reels at the time as a "United Nations" victory? How about when Frederick the Great of Prussia said it? How about when Napolean said it? It has had very different connotations over the centuries, it wasn't anything new to say in trying to describe a world-wide realignment of power.. I believe it was a perfect description for the post-Cold War Era which was being shaped by us, the only remaining super power, and Russia, the former head of the Soviet Bloc. The fixation by people on this one phrase, but only on one of the times it was used, is almost assine.
